description:
In Icehouse the following worked:

nova boot --flavor 4 --boot-volume 13cf15c8-e5fa-484f-b8b5-54e1498dfb48 spacewalk --nic net-id=a0e8f4f0-c1c4-483d-9524-300fcede7a69,v4-fixed-ip=10.71.0.206

However with Juno the only way to make it work is to remove the v4-fixed-ip= setting. The Debug logs are as follows:

title: v4-fixed-ip= not working with nova networking

comments.content:
In Icehouse the following worked:

nova boot --flavor 4 --boot-volume 13cf15c8-e5fa-484f-b8b5-54e1498dfb48 spacewalk --nic net-id=a0e8f4f0-c1c4-483d-9524-300fcede7a69,v4-fixed-ip=10.71.0.206

from the call trace, this None type access is happening at 
Network object, 

    def _from_db_object(context, network, db_network):
        for field in network.fields:
            db_value = db_network[field] <<<---------

db_network is None, which is passed from 

fixed_ip object, 

    def get_by_address(cls, context, address, expected_attrs=None):
        if expected_attrs is None:
            expected_attrs = []
        db_fixedip = db.fixed_ip_get_by_address(context, str(address),
                                                columns_to_join=expected_attrs)

db_fixedip is None for some reason.

I'v checked the latest code change,  and this may fix your issue, not sure, but better to have a look at this.

commit 31b0961c856339bc4844977790a3c17606e3281b
Author: Vishvananda Ishaya <email address hidden>
Date:   Thu Sep 4 23:25:32 2014 -0700

    Use database joins for fixed ips to other objects
    
    Many of the fixed ip related calls are extremely inefficient. This
    joins a couple of calls so that we can optimize queries that use
    them.
    
    Change-Id: Ifa2e4c6ac517286f7ae952052d29801b45a6b6b2
    Partial-bug: #1365606
